THE LISA 2020 NETWORK IS CENTERED AT THE LABORATORY FOR INTERDISCIPLINARY STATISTICAL ANALYSIS (LISA) AT CU BOULDER AND IS CURRENTLY COMPRISED OF 10 NEW STAT LABS IN LMIC HEIS AT U. OF IBADAN, OBAFEMI AWOLOWO U., ANCHOR U., NASAWARA ST. U., AND FEDERAL U. OF TECHNOLOGY, AKURE IN NIGERIA; HAWASSA U. AND WOLKITE U. IN ETHIOPIA; SOKOINE U. OF AGRICULTURE, TANZANIA; UFRN, BRAZIL; AND U. OF ZIMBABWE. EACH STAT LAB HAS THREE MISSIONS: (1) TRAIN STATISTICIANS AND DATA SCIENTISTS TO BECOME EFFECTIVE, INTERDISCIPLINARY COLLABORATORS WHO CAN MOVE BETWEEN THEORY AND PRACTICE TO SOLVE PROBLEMS FOR REAL-WORLD IMPACT; (2) SERVE AS COLLABORATION INFRASTRUCTURE FOR RESEARCHERS AND DECISION-MAKERS TO ENABLE AND ACCELERATE RESEARCH AND DATA-BASED DECISIONS THAT MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON SOCIETY; (3) TEACH SHORT COURSES AND WORKSHOPS TO IMPROVE STATISTICAL AND DATA SCIENCE SKILLS AND LITERACY WIDELY.

CENTRAL TO THE APPROACH OF THE MUST ISP ARE TWO KEY PRINCIPLES: (1) INNOVATION IS A PROCESS, NOT A PRODUCT, AND (2) INDIVIDUALS BEST LEARN THE PROCESS OF INNOVATION THROUGH PRACTICE. THE JOINTLY CREATED LUANAR ISP PROVED THAT AN EXPERIENTIAL EDUCATION-BASED CAPACITY DEVELOP 5 PROGRAM CAN INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF AN HEI TO TEACH, RESEARCH, AND USE SCIENCE TO CREATE INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS TO LOCAL PROBLEMS1. THE MUST ISP IS AN EXPANSION OF THE LUANAR ISP, AND WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: (1) IMPROVE HEIS¿ INSTITUTIONAL ENVIRONMENT TO SUPPORT INNOVATION; (2) BUILD THE CAPACITY OF HEIS¿ RESEARCHERS AND GRADUATES TO USE SCIENCE TO SOLVE LOCAL PROBLEMS; (3) STRENGTHEN THE NETWORK CONNECTIONS BETWEEN HEIS AND OTHER ELEMENTS OF MALAWI¿S  INNOVATION ECOSYSTEM; AND (4) IDENTIFY KEY PROCESSES NECESSARY TO ENABLE THE ISP PROGRAM TO SCALE AT OTHER HEIS.  THE SUCCESS OF THE MUST ISP DEPENDS ON MEETING THE PROGRAM¿S FOUR OBJECTIVES:  (1) IMPROVE HEIS¿ INSTITUTIONAL ENVIRONMENT TO SUPPORT INNOVATION.  (2) BUILD THE CAPACITY OF HEIS¿ RESEARCHERS AND GRADUATES TO USE SCIENCE TO SOLVE LOCAL PROBLEMS.  (3) STRENGTHEN THE NETWORK CONNECTIONS BETWEEN HEIS AND OTHER ELEMENTS OF THE INNOVATION ECOSYSTEM IN MALAWI.  (4) IDENTIFY KEY PROCESSES NECESSARY TO ENABLE THE ISP PROGRAM TO SCALE AT OTHER HEIS.

THE PISBIC KENYA PROJECT AIMS TO SUSTAINABLY ADVANCE  THE INSTITUTE OF BIOMEDICAL INFORMATICS (IBMI) AT MOI UNIVERSITY  TO BECOME A REGIONAL LEADER IN HEALTH INFORMATICS  (HI). CORE PARTNERS FOR PISBIC KENYA HAVE BEEN DELIBERATELY  SELECTED BASED ON SEVERAL FACTORS AS OUTLINED IN TABLE  1. PARTNERS INCLUDE TWO KENYAN HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS  (HEIS) (MOI & AGA KHAN UNIVERSITIES), TWO US-BASED HEIS (VUMC & PURDUE), A PUBLIC  SECTOR PARTNER (KENYA MINISTRY OF HEALTH [MOH]), AND A PRIVATE SECTOR PARTNER (VERVE KO).

THE USAID GHANA COUNTRY DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION STRATEGY (CDCS) IDENTIFIES KEY BARRIERS TO INCLUSIVE ECONOMIC GROWTH, INCLUDING LOW AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTIVITY, LIMITED ACCESS TO SUSTAINABLE ENERGY, HIGH BURDEN OF DISEASE AND POOR HEALTH, AND DIFFICULTIES OF SMALL ENTERPRISES IN ACCESSING CREDIT. ASHESI GRADUATES ARE WELL POISED TO SCALE SOCIAL VENTURES ADVANCING INTEGRATED SOLUTIONS TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS THESE DEVELOPMENT CHALLENGES. EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS LIKE ASHESI ARE WELL POISED TO INSTILL THE KNOWLEDGE, ATTITUDES, AND SKILLS THAT THE NEXT GENERATION OF ENTREPRENEURS WILL NEED TO PROPEL THIS ECOSYSTEM TO MATURITY. HOWEVER, SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP CAN BE SEEN AS AN UNPROVEN CAREER CHOICE BY YOUNG GRADUATES AND THEIR  FAMILIES. EARLY ALUMNI PROGRAMS DE-RISK THESE IMPACTFUL CAREER PATHS, PROVIDING STRUCTURED PROGRAM OFFERINGS AND FUNDING TO SUPPORT BUDDING ENTREPRENEURS TO CHANGE THESE CULTURAL PERCEPTIONS OVER TIME. AS AN ACADEMIC AND ENTREPRENEURIAL LEADER, ASHESI UNIVERSITY IS WELL POSITIONED TO WORK CLOSELY WITH MIT D-LAB, BUILDING INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY IN: 1) SUPPORTING RECENT ALUMNI TO SUCCESSFULLY NAVIGATE GROWTH OF SUSTAINABLE SOCIAL VENTURES, 2) TEACHING ETHICAL USER RESEARCH TO EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND 3) CONVENING THE GHANAIAN ENTREPRENEURSHIP ECOSYSTEM TO ACHIEVE DEVELOPMENT OUTCOMES.  1. ACCELERATING SUSTAINABLE SOCIAL VENTURES  2. LEAN RESEARCH FOR SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURS  3. ECOSYSTEMS BUILDING AND CONVENING

YOUTHMAPPERS ADDRESSES A FUNDAMENTAL CHALLENGE FACED BY THE HUMANITARIAN AND DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY IS THE  LACK OF OPEN AND ACCESSIBLE SPATIAL DATA FOR MAKING SOUND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY  RESILIENCE POLICY DECISIONS. LACK OF DATA IS RECOGNIZED AS ONE OF THE BIGGEST OBSTACLES TO PROGRESS TOWARDS  DEVELOPMENT GOALS (UN 2014). OPEN GEOSPATIAL DATA HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE UN AND WORLD BANK AS  HAVING A KEY ROLE IN ECONOMIC, SOCIAL, AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT (UNGGIM 2017). BUT CREATING DATA ALONE  IS INSUFFICIENT TO ASSURE THAT LMIC COMMUNITIES ARE ABLE TO USE IT AND APPLY IT TO LOCAL RESILIENCE NEEDS AND  DEVELOPMENT DECISIONS. PROGRESS ON LOCALIZING THE BENEFITS OF SUCH A PUBLIC RESOURCE IS LIMITED BY A LACK  OF NATIVE CAPACITY TO ANALYZE AND USE SUCH DATA. WITH THIS IN MIND, WE CREATED YOUTHMAPPERS TO ¿NOT JUST  BUILD MAPS, BUT BUILD MAPPERS.¿ BY EMBEDDING VOLUNTEER DATA CREATION WITHIN THE ACADEMIC SECTOR, WHICH  PRODUCES THE NEXT GENERATION WORKFORCE, AND LINKING THE DATA DIRECTLY TO END-USERS IN THE HUMANITARIAN AND  DEVELOPMENT SECTOR, WE INSTILL TECHNICAL SKILLS, AND REINFORCE CAREER ASPIRATIONS TO IMPROVE LIVES IN LMIC.  OUR OBJECTIVES ALIGN WITH THE GOALS OF USAID TO ACCELERATE LMIC CAPACITY FOR HIGH-LEVEL SCIENCE,  TECHNOLOGY, PARTNERSHIP SUPPORT, AND INNOVATION BY: (1) SUPPORTING YOUTHMAPPERS TO CREATE FOUNDATIONAL  QUALITY GEOSPATIAL DATA IN UNDERMAPPED PLACES WHERE USAID HAS A PRESENCE, MAKING IT AVAILABLE AS A  PUBLIC GOOD, WHERE IT CAN BE USED FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY RESILIENCE APPLICATIONS; (2)  BUILDING CAPACITY AMONG YOUTHMAPPERS TO CREATE THEIR OWN LOCAL PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVED COMMUNITIES, AND GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT  AND WORKFORCE-ENHANCING OPPORTUNITIES; AND (3) PROVIDING THE LEADERSHIP AND ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO  GROW AND MANAGE AN INCLUSIVE AND EMPOWERING NETWORK. THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON THE  MOST SUCCESSFUL IMPACTS AND A GAPS ASSESSMENT FROM THE ESTABLISHMENT PHASE OF YOUTHMAPPERS AND RELATE  TO SCALING UP DATA PRODUCTION & QUALITY; OFFERING MEANINGFUL LEADERSHIP AND CAPACITY BUILDING; AND  STRENGTHENING INSTITUTIONAL ADOPTION.

THE UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID), THROUGH THE CENTER FOR DEVELOPMENT RESEARCH (CDR) IN THE U.S. GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT LAB (LAB) PLANS TO INVEST IN A FIVE-YEAR COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH A HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTION (HEI)  TO SUPPORT A PROJECT ENTITLED LONG-TERM  ASSISTANCE AND SERVICES FOR RESEARCH  (LASER). THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AIMS TO SUPPORT THE DISCOVERY AND UPTAKE OF UNIVERSITY-SOURCED, EVIDENCE-BASED SOLUTIONS TO DEVELOPMENT CHALLENGES.
